data.title: Morgan Stanley’s Social Media Valuations Now Look Less Overvalued Than Peers
data.text: Social media has been a game changer for society. Whether the change will have been a net positive or a net negative remains to be seen, but the companies behind social media are incredibly powerful, despite the current concerns about them.

data.title: Twitter Rallies on Rumors of a New Subscription Service – Cycles Bullish
data.text: On Wednesday morning Twitter released a new job posting for an internal team codenamed “Gryphon.” In the job listing, the company noted that they were working to build a subscription-based platform.

data.title: Twitter (TWTR) Catches Eye: Stock Jumps 7.3%
data.text: Twitter (TWTR) saw a big move last session, as its shares jumped more than 7% on the day, amid huge volumes.

data.title: Twitter Stock on Fire After Subscription Service Chatter
data.text: Momentum traders jumped into Twitter stock after reports that it will start a premium service to increase revenues.

data.title: Is Twitter Jumping on the Subscription Bandwagon -- or Not?
data.text: The advertising market is taking a hit from COVID-19, and a paid subscription tier for power users could help mitigate those impacts.

data.title: Twitter job posting hints at new subscription service
data.text: A job posting from Twitter has some wondering if the social media platform is planning to launch a subscription service.

data.title: As Twitter and Facebook find fake networks of accounts, are they merely scratching the surface?
data.text: On Wednesday Facebook deep-sixed four different networks of pages and accounts that were found guilty of "coordinated inauthentic behavior" -- the kinds of cheating and spamming that soil the social media landscape.
